definition: superfluous/cumbersome/a burden on sb/a nuisance to sb/to inconvenience/to tie sb down/long-winded (of writing)/also pr. [lei2 zhui5]
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
rope/to bind together/to twist around
surname Lei
superfluous/redundant/cumbersome/refers to a son-in-law living with wife's family

sentences.english: Now I should be an encumbrance .
Magdalena considered the past an irrelevant encumbrance.
sentences.chinese: 玛格达莱娜把过去看作毫不相干的累赘。

sentences.english: This proved to be very cumbersome.
sentences.chinese: 但是这样做会非常累赘。

sentences.english: The foreign aid to the country was believed to be nothing but a white elephant.
sentences.chinese: 那个国度得到的外助岂但无益而且成了繁重的累赘。

sentences.english: If you have an opportunity to vent out the cumbersome.
sentences.chinese: 如果有机会可以渲泄掉累赘。

sentences.english: When he planned apt sell his concern, his valuable furnishings became pearly elephants.
sentences.chinese: 他想要卖房的时候，那些昂贵的家具竟成了累赘。

sentences.english: This excrescence only needs to be sold or closed-down.
sentences.chinese: 这样的累赘只能卖掉或者关闭。

sentences.english: In many respects, the body of a PDD victim becomes their puppet.
sentences.chinese: 在很多方面，PDD患者的身体变成了他们的累赘。

sentences.english: And that leads to a lot of redundant computation.
Are In-Store Shops a Problem for Department Stores?
sentences.chinese: 店中店会否成为百货商店的累赘？

sentences.english: Am I a encumbrance in your eyes?
sentences.chinese: 在你看来，我已经成为累赘？

sentences.english: The scandal-ridden congressman has become a drag on his party.
sentences.chinese: 这个丑闻缠身的国会议员成了他所在政党的累赘。

sentences.english: Professor Gravity now seems to have become an unwanted fixture in the college.
sentences.chinese: 格雷维蒂教授现在似乎成了学院里的累赘。

sentences.english: Pentium wise, pen and paper foolish.
By whittling off unwanted parts, the car's performance will be brought into full play.
sentences.chinese: 削去累赘的部分能最大限度地提高该汽车的性能。
却不小心成为你的累赘。

definition: (derog.) (of a woman) to bring one's children into a second marriage/children by a previous marriage
wrapping cloth/a bundle wrapped in cloth/load/weight/burden/funny part/punchline
not essential/dispensable
but on the contrary/but expectedly
useless/worthless
to give up/to abandon/to abort
to impede/to obstruct/to hold back
to encumber/to be a burden on/to implicate
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
helper/assistant
chicken ribs/sth of little value or interest/sth of dubious worth that one is reluctant to give up/to be physically weak
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
instead/on the contrary/contrary (to expectations)
handicapped person/useless person
to entail strenuous effort/to toil at a task/strenuous/laborious/strain
unexpectedly
